alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 01 at 2:03AM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except up to 20 inches in the higher mountains. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast, Central Douglas County and Eastern Curry County and Josephine County. * WHEN...From 11 pm this evening to 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels could drop to as low as 1500 feet Sunday morning in the Illinois Valley and also the passes on Interstate 5 north of Grants Pass to Canyon Creek Pass. However, most accumulating snow will be above that. Colder air will arrive Sunday night into Monday with a higher risk of road snow in those same areas. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; South Central Oregon Coast
